eu.excitement.entailment.core.representation.parsetree

Class DefaultNodeInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.excitement.entailment.core.representation.parsetree.DefaultNodeInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NodeInfo, java.io.Serializable

    public class DefaultNodeInfo
extends java.lang.Object
implements NodeInfo
    [DELETEME_LATER: imported from BIUTEE 2.4.1 with no modification - but some enums are different - POS & NER] This class is immutable, provided the underlying implementations of the type: SyntacticInfo is immutable as well.

    To create a NodeInfo with word, lemma, etc. - use the constructor.
    To create a NodeInfo that represents a variable (X_1, X_2, etc.), use the methods newVariableDefaultNodeInfo(Integer, SyntacticInfo) and newVariableDefaultNodeInfo(Integer, String, int, NamedEntity, SyntacticInfo).

    Author:
    Asher Stern
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getSerial

        public int getSerial()
        Specified by:
        getSerial in interface NodeInfo
        Returns:
        the serial (location in the sentence) of the word represented by this node. The returned value is undefined if the node does not represent a word. (You can know whether the node represents a node by testing whether NodeInfo.getWord() returns null).

        public java.lang.String getWord()

        Returns:
        the word. or null if this node does not represent a word.

      • getWordLemma

        public java.lang.String getWordLemma()
        Description copied from interface: NodeInfo
        Returns the lemma (root form) of the node. For example, "was" has lemma "be". "went" has lemma "go". Note, that whether that information exists depends on the parser. null is legal here.

        My advice, if the parser does not returns this information, Use another tool (hopefully you have another tool for that) on the BasicConstructionNodes returned by the EnglishSingleTreeParser to add this information.

        Specified by:
        getWordLemma in interface NodeInfo
        Returns:
        the lemma (root form) of the node
